number of helpful: 95 of 115 people (83%) found this review helpful26 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 24, 2015
Early Access Review
								Okay. Where to start? Imagine yourself, for a moment, as a lion. King (or queen) of the Savanna. Within a few minutes you find yourself thirsty. You go down to the wateringhole and have yourself a nice drink. Time to relax? Nope. Now you're hungry. Time to go get food. So you bring down a wildebeast by chasing it around for a few minutes and biting it whenever you can. Eat the meat and now you're full. Time to relax yet? Nope. You're thirsty again. So, to the waterhole again. By the time you find a spot where there isn't a croc eyeing you and get a drink, well how about that, you're starving! Repeat this process two or three more times. Oh, but wouldn't you know it, a meerkat has ran up to you in the tall grass and you can't fricking see it. So you, one of the most deadly predators of the biome, has just been hunted and killed by a small animal that any lion could realistically rip the throat out of with little effort.This game is horribly unbalanced. Pretty much any animal with an aggressive action can kill any other animal with little effort as long as the aggressor knows what to do. The meters for thirst and hunger run down way too quickly, so it's a constant struggle to keep from going thirsty or hungry that ends up being more frustrating than fun. As a carnivore, you don't feel the thrill of hunting, outwitting, and overpowering your prey, it's just a chore. As a herbivore, it's just a matter of running back and forth from a patch of edible plants and the river over and over again. It gets terribly repetative. The controls are awkward and the button to shift between aggressive and peaceful actions cycles way too quickly with anything more than the very slightest tap likely to land you on the same one you were already on.If this game interests you, try the free version online first. Trust me, the two aren't all that different and you'll likely understand just how irritating this game is.

												This game is interesting, but sadly there are many things wrong with it. First off, this game is FREE on the developers website, gamevial.com. Be aware alot of the problems mentioned below are also present in the free version. This game also lets you play a wide variety of animals, not found in any other game. Let me mention the pro's and con's of this game:PROs:`A wide selection of animals to play with, including able to play female animals and have children`Different environments`PVP. Bigger animals can fight and eat smaller animals.CONs:`Sadly, this game is abadonware on steam. The developers seemed to not care about it and just quit updating it.`There are some bugs in the game, including invisible totems in the safari map and other maps too.`The original game was free, but this game is paid. `Hackers run amuk in the game and ruined it. There is one particular hacker that i will not mention that is a griefer.`Some of the issues mentioned above is why the servers are pretty much empty.You better off playing the game "MEADOW" for a better experience. The developers actually listen to your suggestions and roll out many updates. Here is a link to it:Negative review sadly due to the above con's of the game. Sadly, this kinda of playing ruined the game. I also think that having PVP in the game kinda ruined it because that made people hack and cheat to be the stronger animal.

												I'm not sure if I understand the point of this game... you sort of spawn into an area as an animal, and you can awkwardly move around an area. Sometimes you randomly turn into another animal. I turned into a bear, and tried to eat a player who was a rabbit. The rabbit obviously knows the game better, because he killed me somehow. Then I think he ate me or mated with me, Im not sure, there's only like 3 sound effects in this game. The animal models don't even act like the animals they're supposed to be. The deer sits like a dog. It's strange. This game feels unfinished, and it's definitely nowhere near a realistic animal sim.

number of helpful: 34 of 44 people (77%) found this review helpful9 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 6, 2015
Early Access Review
								A Great experience.I've been playing this from the start including the online version, and there are huge leaps in quality in the last few weeks.Game play is quirky, and goals are obtuse, but I think that's intentional. Basically If you keep yourself alive you're winning, and what else you do is up to you.It looks like their answer to hacking is to disconnect the game from the web player version right now. It makes things kinda quiet right now in multiplayer but I guess we'll see how that pans out, and on the upside you can now play directly with your friends via steam, which is a bit more relaxed than the previously manic "anything goes" web experience.I love flying about which feels fluid in a way that many games misss somehow, and just running about as an animal is fun.The landscapes are ok, with beautiful moments mixed with not so beautiful. Generally it looks good.It's not educational, it's just mucking about.I'd say if you ever wanted to run about like an animal in it's natural environment this game is for you, but obviously if you want huge story driven game or fps action then it's not. Within it's remit I reccomends it :)

number of helpful: 11 of 14 people (79%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 13, 2015
Early Access Review
								The idea behind Lif is a unique one. Playing as different animals in their natural habitat as you explore and stay alive can be a fun challenge. This Early Access version is (currently) pretty much the same as Gamevial's free-to-play version in the browser; by paying for the Early Access, you'll get updates that bring Lif closer to its realization as a more realistic animal simulator/survival game.Lif is open-world, similar to Gamevial's Fly Like a Bird 3, but Lif takes survival to another level. Naturally the animals chase and kill each other constantly because Lif allows you to attack or befriend as you please, but we can expect improvements in gameplay as Lif evolves. There's fun in being able to roam around doing what you want anyway, and we'll be able to do more as the game gets better. Lif has huge potential, and as with any game, the only way it will improve is by supporting its development.

content:
Posted: June 24, 2015
Early Access Review
								Here is my "First Day on Launch Day" video and "Early Access REVIEW" Video:


YouTube™ Video: LIF - First Play on Launch Day and Review 

			Views: 20,108		

			Let's game looks cute and cuddly, and even full of fun PvP action as an "all-natural" survival animal playing game, but is it actually any fun?		

The game is fun all for about 20 minutes.  Tops.  It's very early in access, and very rough, but the graphics look promising enough to make it a good game.  The biggest question is will they ever stick around to complete it and make it something that truly lasts and make it something that is fun to play for more then a very short period of time?  Doubtful in my eyes, but I hope they prove me wrong!Watch my video link above if you want to see why this game got a 47% early access score from me.  Thumbs down.  There's just far better ways to spend your money then this.  Toilet Paper in the real world is certainly one of them!

												I absolutly love this game! Though there are some thing that you maybe can add into the game:Let's start with the homes: When I came across this game, I saw holes for the animals you start out as like rabbits and merekats. But I didn't see homes for anything else, what you could have is a home for every creature you can be, like nests for the birds and the lizards, dens for the predators, and so on.                                                                                                               Next is a glitch that is only in the savannah: I was looking for a lion totem, but I couldn't find one, and when I did, it was invisable. No wonder it was so hard to find. So if you can fix this glitch then I woud be glad, also I think the elephant and crocodile totems are invisable as well in the savannah. Then I would like to add is the new update with the Grizzly in the Tundra: In real life, Grizzly bears are one of the most powerful land animals so it should deal with the most damage, now it does the same damage as a rabbit? I'm sorry but that right there makes no sense. If the Grizzly did the most damage in the tundra then I would be happy. And the final thing is your death: Yes I get it that animals die, but that doesn't mean you exit the server, I mean like come on really? If there was a respawn then that would be great, but not exit the enitre server.Thank you for reading my review and I hope you keep on making this game better then before

content:
Posted: July 4, 2016
												The controls are barely explained and are very difficult to use. The bars within the game that run out after a certain amount of time aren't explained either - you have to guess what it all is. I'm guessing the first bar is overall health, the green is food, and the blue is thirst? Not sure. Not even the main menu has many words signifying what the symbols mean (like for multiplayer, single player, control help, etc). The game is very glitchy, too, and doesn't live up to all expectations. It was funny for the 1.7 hours of play time, but not something I'd consistently play over the course of months or even a year or two. Fighting is difficult, finding food is difficult if you're not a meat eater, and the designs are pretty bad in general - the animations glitch and what happens on your screen doesn't happen on the other person's.

content:
Posted: July 25, 2016
												I like this version much better over the Browser version which had too many hackers. The only problems that I see right now that can be easily fixed are these:Too many aggressive animals: Depending on the animal you are of course. That part is fine. I expect to be scared of attack all the time when I'm a rabbit or something small. But a large animal like a Wildebeast shouldn't have to be afraid of Meerkats. The only thing that should be aggressive to animals similar to the Wildebeast are the large predators. The Fennic Fox is a different story. Why is the horse aggressive to me? While in the game you can hunt anything, horses, I don't think would instantly go for a fox.Finally, the same gender. For males I can understand or females depending on the species. But there are too many. I don't care much for always being on constant attack by my own kind. Especially animals that live in groups.The Controls: Everything is done with 'ctrl' basically. This is a huge problem I think. Since I am always under attack when I try to fight, I end up eating (if I am prey this is usually where this becomes a problem) or drinking (if I am near water). It would be better if the attack button was a different button than the 'action' button. I am totally cool with eating/drinking/nuzzling being the same button. As those are specific and easy to go about than trying to fight while my head is down eating.The scent button would also be better off as a different button as well. Same issue as with the attacking.Animations:I loved the animation of the tundra hare, and I think it would be great to add that to the hare in the forest. The new animals have some great animations and so I feel the older original animals need an upgrade to their models.The Good Stuff:I saw a lot of improvements. I was really impressed. I think the biggest problem were the hackers on multiplayer which, thankfully, are gone with the steam version. The game has a lot of potential. The new animals and habitats are great. I look forward to seeing cool updates.For $9-10 this is an okay game and not much of waste, especially since things are being updated.Suggestions:I saw someone had suggested homes for all the animals in the area. I support that idea. A plains area would be cool. We have the Savanna, but I was thinking a North American plain with new animals like the Bison and mice. A prehistoric map. Not dinosaurs, but more the ancient mammals like the Mammoth and Smilodon.

												When I first got the game, I was really excited for it. But the more and more I played it, I realized how horrible the game actually is. Even the players are horrible! The animation is just one cycle over and over and over. It's almost impossible to find totem poles and even make it to the next animal! I mean, the game would be a whole lot better if the players weren't such jerks! And I can't even communicate with them. I really think that this game needs ton of improvement. Like, you can host your own server and kick out players. Players who are even the same animal as you will try to kill you. Unless you like being killed constantly and never being able to get revenge, don't get this game! Please save your money.

content:
Posted: January 21, 2016
												This game was not fun.  First off, the controls.  WASD is all you have for movement.  No looking up or down or using the mouse to quickly look behind you.  If you want to see whats behind you, you have to hold A or S until you are completly turned around.  You've just climbed to the top  of that hill and now you want to see whats below?  you gotta start walking down before the camera lets you see whats down.  Some people say its fun for 10 minutes.  There is no fun.  I really don't know how some people in here play 400 hours on this thing.   I mean, you walk around, you eat and thats it.  Need to pause the game in single player mode?  Sorry, no pause.  Hit esc and you die.

												If you dont know what the health, hunger & thirst bars are you clearly havent played a survival simulator game before. A very fun game, though some things in single player need to be fixed, like the horse in the desert randomly attacking a fennec fox. But are there any bird totems in the forest? because i need to get better bearings. And i like the way the animals look ( well, on most of them anyway) but the animations need some work. And herbivores in single player shouldnt just go run up to a preadator and attack randomly ( ex. Deer attacks wolf) But a very good game and concept, just needs a bit of work.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 30, 2016
												This game is... It. People complain about not getting to pick an animal, clearly they know little about the game before playing.The idea of using a totem to pick a new animal is interesting to me. You need to work to get the better creatures.Pros:-Interesting concept-The more recent animals have nice models-Unlike many other games, you gan eat grass-You can breed-When on an empty server or single player, there are active npcs-New and interesting ways to choose a new character-The animals suit their environmentsCons:-The older animals have poor animations and models-It can be difficult to learn the game's mechanics-Slightly odd controls-Small array of animals to choose from-Peculiar mechanicsOverall, more pros than cons, I had fun playing this game!

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 3, 2016
												Okay listen up :) Honestly, I've known the other 2 versions that aren't on Steam. I have played them for over 2 years, and I loved them. Minus the hackers. But now that it is on Steam, it's super frustrating. People can always know you're playin it, no matter your name is changed in the game or not. Not even your Steam name. Want to know why I'm writing a BAD review? It's because I've had ENOUGH of these childish players that won't let any others have fun. They kill you and insult you as soon as you enter the same server as them. It's cyber-bullying. People can actually get hurt over these things. Don't say "Just stop playing the game" because it's not fair. People are supposed to respect each other whether they like each other or NOT. The people I've had enough of would be Ariana, jxrhoads, Shinusaur, and spirit. That's all I can think of for now. So you have been warned, play the game if you wish :) watch out for those people. And if you don't, do not try to come to me for it.

												Can't believe I actually payed money for this. It could be great, but the camera is practically non existant, the controls are wonky, and there isn't a good tutorial to help you understand what it is you're suppose to do. How do you defend yourself? Maybe it'll get better but until it does, not worth playing unless it's free.

content:
Posted: June 24, 2015
Early Access Review
								What I like< This particular version >:- A lot better graphics than any previous version on Gamevial.com- More stable framerate all a better performance altogether- Good pricing- Stand-alone game; no more webplayer! <Take that, Chrome>< In General >:- Unique, simple gameplay- Interesting community- Weirdness; sometimes strange stuff will happen ingame- Balanced playable characters; Wolf, Rabbit, Deer, Bear, Fox and more!What I don't like:- No complaints.Altogether I'd like to say; Well done, Gamevial. You've created one of the most addicting games ever.It may have some quirks, but nothing that couldn't be fixed. And now that the game is on steam, it'llbecome the game it always wanted to be.

content:
Posted: April 14, 2016
												Overall, its OK. Play multiplayer, the NPC in singleplayer are out for blood, so unless you're looking for a fight, try to hang out on a server and chat with anyone online. The graphics are ok and you can learn as you go, but it's a fairly simple game.I'd say if you're bored and got the extra nine bucks, and like random eat/hangout/fight/wander listlessly games, you'll be ok.If you want direction, story, or depth, maybe give it a pass. It's pretty much a sandbox.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 4, 2016
												There are only a few good animals in this game. Starting as a rabbit, you just eat grass all day. If you attack an animal, it follows you until it dies (singleplayer). Nobody told me you could die of thirst. This is clearly a remake of fly like a bird, but not everybody remembers how to play that game. A little bit of a tutorial or more elaborate control bindings would be nice. Runes on the UI page are cute but unhelpful. Seriously, paws and flowers? Sometimes you just have to get the text out (remember your end users are humans and not dingos). Worth a play though, you might like the game if you can figure it out.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 6, 2016
												I like the concept of being able to play as an animal with friends, but i do think some major changes need to be made. I mostly play single player because nobody is ever online. The npc's are either always running away from you, don't mind you or mercilessly chasing you until you kill them off, only for them to start chasing you again. When I play as the lion, the 'king of the jungle' im always being chased by something that wants to kill me that would ignore me in real life. The lion is so weak aswell, like one lion would at least be stronger than a wolf. The baby animals are just small adults and it just looks strange and there are very few sound effects in this game. When there are people online, someone on the server just will not stop killing people and nobody can do anything about it and its very annoying. A small update that just adds a few features like a ban vote in online games and making single player easier for when nobody is online would make the game more enjoyable. I would however recommend this game as it is very fun, but only buy it if you like the demo version.
